title: Understanding the Denominator
text: When finding the domain of a function, you need to ensure the denominator of any fraction isn't zero, as dividing by zero is undefined. Can you identify the values of $$x$$ that would make the denominator $$(2-x)$$ equal to zero?

title: Solving for Zero in Denominator
text: To find when the denominator becomes zero, set it equal to zero and solve for $$x$$ in the equation $$(2-x)=0$$.

title: Rational Functions and Domain
text: The domain of the function is all the possible input values (x values) except those that make any denominator zero. This is because dividing by zero is undefined in mathematics.

title: Combining Information
text: You have found that $$x=2$$ makes the denominator zero. So, the domain includes all real numbers except $$x=2$$.

title: Understanding 'All real numbers'
text: In mathematics, 'all real numbers' mean any point on a continuous number line. So when we exclude a number, like $$x=2$$, it simply becomes not accessible for this function's input.
